title: Jefferies readies Affinity's MedicalDirector for buyers
text:
Investment bank Jefferies Australia is helping private equity firm Affinity Equity Partners as it tests buyer appetite for medical practice management software company MedicalDirector.

While the sale process is at a very early stage, Jefferies has started contacting trade and other potential buyers to introduce the company, as first reported by this column on Tuesday.

MedicalDirector will participate in a UK government investment program to upgrade GP practice software and clinical health record technology through its GP IT Futures program. Alamy

Sources said Jefferies had been tasked with identifying a wide universe of global buyers and would be roadshowing the company offshore.

MedicalDirector will no doubt be keen to point out it was this week selected to participate in the UK's $600 million investment program to upgrade GP practice software and clinical health record technology in the National Health Service.

This marked the first time the NHS had opened up the market to a new general practice healthcare software player in over 12 years.
description: Jefferies Australia is helping Affinity Equity Partners as it tests buyer appetite for MedicalDirector.
